alert.note: Alert for Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 23 at 6:38AM EDT until September 23 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Bronx, Northwest Suffolk, Northern Queens and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline, due to elevated water levels and 2 to 4 ft breaking surf. Breaking waves will also result in minor beach erosion and flooding during the time of high tide. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of minor coastal flooding are possible Sunday into early next week, particularly during the afternoon high tide.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Bronx; Northern Nassau; Northern Queens; Northwest Suffolk
